|coordinates = {{coord|40|21|0|N|3|50|0|W|region:ES|display=inline}} |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = 695 |elevation_ft = |postal_code_type = [[Postal code]] |postal_code = 28921–28925 |area_code = +34 ([[Spain|ES]]) + 91 ([[Community of Madrid|M]]) |website = {{official website|http://www.ayto-alcorcon.es}} |footnotes = }} '''Alcorcón''' ({{IPA-es|alkoɾˈkon}}) is a city in the [[Community of Madrid]], Spain. {{as of|2016}}, it had a population of 167,354.[http://www.ine.es/jaxiT3/Tabla.htm?t=2881&L=0 Population Madrid's municipalities (INE)] == History == The site appears to have been inhabited since prehistoric times. The name is of Arabic origin, but little is known of Alcorcón before the [[Reconquista]]. The first recorded written reference to Alcorcón is in a court document (''{{ill|privilegio rodado|es}}'') dated on 28 July 1208, in the context of the territorial strife over {{ill|El Real de Manzanares|es}} between the city councils of [[Madrid]] and [[Segovia]] that took place in the Middle Ages.{{Cite book|page=7|chapter-url=https://dialnet.unirioja.es/descarga/articulo/6202309.pdf |title=V Congreso virtual sobre historia de las vías de comunicación: 15 al 30 de septiembre de 2017 |editor=Enrique Escobedo Molinos |editor2=Juan Antonio López Cordero |editor3=Manuel Cabrera Espinosa |year=2017|chapter=Caminos reales, cañadas, veredas y coladas a su paso por Alcorcón|first=María Isabel|last=Rodríguez Iglesias}} Alcorcón has a small historic centre (including the church of [[Santa María la Blanca, Alcorcón|Santa María la Blanca]]), which is protected as an "archaeological zone".{{citation needed|date=November 2016}} The centre is surrounded by modern developments, as Alcorcón has been growing rapidly in recent times due to migration from other parts of Spain and Latin America. == People == * [[La Terremoto de Alcorcón]], Singer * El_Meswy, [[Rapper]], [[hip hop music]] singer. ==Transport== [[Alcorcón station|Alcorcón]] is linked to Madrid by [[Madrid Metro|Metro]] [[Line 10 (Madrid Metro)|Line 10]] and [[Line 12 (Madrid Metro)|Line 12]], [[Cercanías Madrid|Cercanías]] line [[C-5 (Cercanías Madrid)|C-5]] and several buses (511, 512, 513, 514, 516, 518, 536, 541, 545, 546, 547, 548, 551, N501, N502, N504). ==Sport== The city is home to the football team [[AD Alcorcón|Agrupación Deportiva de Alcorcón]] that plays [[Segunda División]]. And also [[CF Trival Valderas|Trival Valderas]] that plays [[Tercera División]]. In addition [[Club Atlético de Madrid]] is going to build training facilities in the north of the municipality. Alcorcón also has an American football team called The Alcorcon Smilodons, whose colors are yellow and navy blue. ==Architecture== Alcorcón has two hospitals, the [[Fundación Hospital de Alcorcón]] (which is state owned, but run privately), and the [[Hospital Sur Madrid]] (a totally private hospital). The Alcorcón campus of the [[Universidad Rey Juan Carlos]] teaches health-related courses. In February 2013, it was announced that [[Eurovegas]] would be built in Alcorcón.{{cite news |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/id/50743178/ns/local_news-las_vegas_nv |title=Spain's Alcorcon town chosen for EuroVegas resort |date=8 February 2013 }} However, in December 2013 the Eurovegas project was officially canceled and it will not be established anywhere in Europe.{{cite web|title=Sheldon Adelson cancels $30bn Eurovegas project in Spain|author=Tobias Buck (Madrid)|publisher=Financial Times (London)|date=13 December 2013|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/3783f5c8-63f7-11e3-98e2-00144feabdc0.html|accessdate=13 December 2013}} ==Twin towns== *{{flagicon|CUB}} [[Mayarí]], Cuba *{{flagicon|El Salvador}} [[Nejapa]], El Salvador *{{flagicon|Peru}} [[Ancón District]], Peru ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == {{commons category|Alcorcón}} *[http://www.ayto-alcorcon.es/ Official website] {{Madrid MA}} {{Municipalities in the Community of Madrid}} {{Coord|40|21|N|03|50|W|display=title}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alcorcon}} [[Category:Alcorcón| ]] [[Category:Municipalities in the Community of Madrid]] [[Category:Populated places in the Community of Madrid]] {{Madrid-geo-stub}}
